pullrequest.title: First version of Displays widget with sample DisplayPlugins

content.raw: Not sure I fully understand this comment, but the order in which the plugins are listed in the config file shouldn't affect how they're displayed since you have a `<window><state>` tag.
content.html: Not sure I fully understand this comment, but the order in which the plugins are listed in the config file shouldn't affect how they're displayed since you have a <window><state> tag.

pull_request.title: First version of Displays widget with sample DisplayPlugins

update.description:
This is the first of a few PRs towards a widget that allows for toggling/configuring of various “displays”.

‌

There is more context about what PRs are to follow in \[this meta-ticket\]\([#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/issues/31](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/issues/31)\) \(to give an idea of what is in/out of scope for this PR\).

‌

There's an example of the widget in `display_plugins.config`added in this PR. There are two example display plugins in this PR:

*  `GridDisplay`: 

    * uses the code from the `Grid3d` plugin, but that plugin is more for introspecting/adding multiple grids, while the `GridDisplay` just manages a single grid. 
    * has configurable properties specific to grids, in addition to the default visibility checkbox for display plugins.
    
* `RealtimeFactorDisplay`: 

    * uses some code from the `TimePanel` plugin, but it paints the RTF on the scene instead of displaying it in the widget \(a feature request from the client\).
    * is not very practical at the moment because it always displays the RTF at the origin of the world as opposed to as an Overlay, but it is an example of a display that does not have any custom configurable properties. 
    * has loading issues in some situations \(e.g. the `display_plugins.config`example\). In other cases it loads fine.
    

‌

I have tried to match the existing layout/practices of the source code: I added the `DisplayPlugin` baseclass where the `Plugin` class was but can move it into the `displays` directory if appropriate.

‌
update.title: First version of Displays widget with sample DisplayPlugins
